definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Sometimes riders urge their horses on with whips.
sentences.chinese: 骑马的人有时用鞭子策马前进。

sentences.english: The whip swished through the air.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子嗖地一声在空中挥动。

sentences.english: The lash bit into him again and again, but he neither whined nor struggled.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子一次次地打在他身上，而他既不哀叫也不挣扎。

sentences.english: It shakes its arms like whips.
sentences.chinese: 它像鞭子一样摆动双手。

sentences.english: It feels as if they are whipping my face with wire whips.
sentences.chinese: 感觉起来就像鞭子打在脸上一样。

sentences.english: Often enough the fishing bosses drove us to the boats with whips .
sentences.chinese: 渔霸经常拿鞭子把我们赶到船上去。

sentences.english: Santa shouted out the reindeers' names and cracked his whip.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞老人喊出驯鹿的名字，猛抽他的鞭子。

sentences.english: Daenerys made do with a word and a whip.
sentences.chinese: 而丹妮莉丝用的是一个词和一条鞭子。

sentences.english: Whips of lightning crack the sky near rural Walton, Nebraska.
sentences.chinese: 闪电的鞭子撕裂了内布拉斯加州沃尔顿市乡下的天空。

sentences.english: The Fei Bin is defending the whip son of river's vegetable and seeing toward the summer rather.
sentences.chinese: 斐彬一边防着江素的鞭子，一边看向夏宁。

sentences.english: One single whip will split the paper in half.
sentences.chinese: 我这一鞭子抽下去，这张纸就一分为二。

sentences.english: I think I left my riding crop in the mortuary.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是把鞭子忘在停尸房了。

sentences.english: He lashed at the servant with a whip.
The dog cringed at the sight of the whip.
She drew circles in the snow with her whip, and slapped it against her boot.
sentences.chinese: 她用鞭子在雪地里画了几个圈，轻轻拍打她的靴子。

sentences.english: This cut Hurstwood like a whip, and made him sullen.
sentences.chinese: 这话像鞭子一样抽痛了赫斯渥。

definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
